title: Under-the-Radar Decor Trends Taking Over Pinterest Right Now
description: Pinterest has always been a goldmine for home decor inspiration, but beneath the surface of popular pins lies a treasure trove of emerging trends just waiting to be discovered. As we delve into the world of under-the-radar decor trends taking over Pinterest right now, prepare to be inspired by fresh ideas that are quietly revolutionizing […] You're reading Under-the-Radar Decor Trends Taking Over Pinterest Right Now, originally posted on Decoist. If you enjoyed this post, be sure to follow Decoist on Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest.
author: Sherry Nothingam
excerpt: Explore the hidden world of emerging decor trends on Pinterest, from unexpected color combinations to unconventional materials that are reshaping home design.
text: Pinterest has always been a goldmine for home decor inspiration, but beneath the surface of popular pins lies a treasure trove of emerging trends just waiting to be discovered. As we delve into the world of under-the-radar decor trends taking over Pinterest right now, prepare to be inspired by fresh ideas that are quietly revolutionizing the way we style our homes. From unexpected color combinations to unconventional materials, these trends are set to make a big impact in the coming months. 1. Embracing Biophilic Design Photo Credit: Canva Pro The concept of biophilic design has been gaining traction on Pinterest, with users increasingly seeking ways to incorporate nature into their living spaces. This trend goes beyond simply adding a few houseplants to your decor; it’s about creating a seamless connection between indoor and outdoor environments. Pinners are exploring innovative ways to integrate natural materials like wood, stone, and rattan into their interiors. From living walls covered in lush greenery to furniture pieces that mimic organic forms, biophilic design is all about fostering a sense of calm and well-being by surrounding ourselves with elements from the natural world. 2. Grandmillennial Style Photo Credit: Canva Pro Move over, minimalism – there’s a new trend in town, and it’s all about embracing the cozy, nostalgic charm of your grandmother’s house. Dubbed “Grandmillennial” style, this trend is a modern reinterpretation of traditional design elements that appeal to younger generations seeking comfort and familiarity in their homes. Pinterest users are pinning images of floral wallpapers, vintage china collections, and antique furniture pieces mixed with contemporary accents. The key to nailing this look is striking a balance between old and new, creating spaces that feel both timeless and fresh. Think ruffled throw pillows paired with sleek modern lamps or chintz curtains framing a minimalist art piece. 3. Japandi Style Photo Credit Widell Boschetti As the name suggests, Japandi is a hybrid trend that combines the best of Japanese and Scandinavian design philosophies. This emerging style is gaining popularity on Pinterest for its ability to create serene, functional spaces that exude warmth and simplicity. Pinners are drawn to the clean lines, natural materials, and muted color palettes characteristic of Japandi interiors. The trend emphasizes minimalism and functionality while incorporating elements of wabi-sabi, the Japanese concept of finding beauty in imperfection. Expect to see lots of light woods, paper lanterns, and handcrafted ceramics in Japandi-inspired spaces. 4. Curved Furniture Photo Credit: Canva Pro Say goodbye to sharp angles and hello to soft, sinuous curves. Pinterest users are increasingly gravitating towards furniture and decor items with rounded edges and organic shapes, creating spaces that feel more inviting and comfortable. From curved sofas and circular coffee tables to arched doorways and rounded mirrors, this trend is all about introducing a sense of flow and movement into our living spaces. The popularity of curved furniture on Pinterest suggests a shift towards more relaxed, informal interiors that prioritize comfort and visual interest over rigid, structured designs. 5. Unexpected Color Combinations Photo Credit: Canva Pro Gone are the days of playing it safe with color – Pinterest is buzzing with images of interiors that feature daring and unexpected color combinations. This trend is all about breaking traditional color rules and embracing bold, unconventional pairings that add personality and visual interest to a space. Users are experimenting with combinations like dusty pink and forest green, mustard yellow and deep purple, or navy blue and burnt orange. These bold color choices are being applied to everything from accent walls and furniture pieces to smaller decor items like throw pillows and artwork, creating spaces that are truly unique and eye-catching. Related Articles Mid Century Modern House – Timeless Architecture and Design Trends 9 Most Trendy Ranch Style House Exterior Paint Colors The Latest Kitchen Trends: How Many Have You Considered? Whether you’re looking to completely overhaul your living space or simply want to incorporate a few fresh ideas into your existing decor, these Pinterest-driven trends provide plenty of inspiration to get you started. Remember, the key to successfully implementing any trend is to make it your own – don’t be afraid to experiment, mix and match, and let your personal style shine through. Happy pinning, and may your home be filled with the perfect blend of trendy and timeless design elements! Ready to bring new life to your home? Subscribe to our newsletter for exclusive interior design tips, trends, and ideas that will transform your space. Click here to subscribe! Sherry is a blogger who loves to live her life to the fullest. She enjoys everything associated with design, décor and stylish modern trends. Born in California, Sherry has grown up on open ranches and in a wild setting, which has defined her taste for design and developed her interest in examining how structures and homes interact with the beauti[...]
html:
Pinterest has always been a goldmine for home decor inspiration, but beneath the surface of popular pins lies a treasure trove of emerging trends just waiting to be discovered. As we delve into the world of under-the-radar decor trends taking over Pinterest right now, prepare to be inspired by fresh ideas that are quietly revolutionizing the way we style our homes. From unexpected color combinations to unconventional materials, these trends are set to make a big impact in the coming months.

1. Embracing Biophilic Design

The concept of biophilic design has been gaining traction on Pinterest, with users increasingly seeking ways to incorporate nature into their living spaces. This trend goes beyond simply adding a few houseplants to your decor; it’s about creating a seamless connection between indoor and outdoor environments.

Pinners are exploring innovative ways to integrate natural materials like wood, stone, and rattan into their interiors. From living walls covered in lush greenery to furniture pieces that mimic organic forms, biophilic design is all about fostering a sense of calm and well-being by surrounding ourselves with elements from the natural world.

2. Grandmillennial Style

Move over, minimalism – there’s a new trend in town, and it’s all about embracing the cozy, nostalgic charm of your grandmother’s house. Dubbed “Grandmillennial” style, this trend is a modern reinterpretation of traditional design elements that appeal to younger generations seeking comfort and familiarity in their homes.

Pinterest users are pinning images of floral wallpapers, vintage china collections, and antique furniture pieces mixed with contemporary accents. The key to nailing this look is striking a balance between old and new, creating spaces that feel both timeless and fresh. Think ruffled throw pillows paired with sleek modern lamps or chintz curtains framing a minimalist art piece.

3. Japandi Style

As the name suggests, Japandi is a hybrid trend that combines the best of Japanese and Scandinavian design philosophies. This emerging style is gaining popularity on Pinterest for its ability to create serene, functional spaces that exude warmth and simplicity.

Pinners are drawn to the clean lines, natural materials, and muted color palettes characteristic of Japandi interiors. The trend emphasizes minimalism and functionality while incorporating elements of wabi-sabi, the Japanese concept of finding beauty in imperfection. Expect to see lots of light woods, paper lanterns, and handcrafted ceramics in Japandi-inspired spaces.

4. Curved Furniture

Say goodbye to sharp angles and hello to soft, sinuous curves. Pinterest users are increasingly gravitating towards furniture and decor items with rounded edges and organic shapes, creating spaces that feel more inviting and comfortable.

From curved sofas and circular coffee tables to arched doorways and rounded mirrors, this trend is all about introducing a sense of flow and movement into our living spaces. The popularity of curved furniture on Pinterest suggests a shift towards more relaxed, informal interiors that prioritize comfort and visual interest over rigid, structured designs.

5. Unexpected Color Combinations

Gone are the days of playing it safe with color – Pinterest is buzzing with images of interiors that feature daring and unexpected color combinations. This trend is all about breaking traditional color rules and embracing bold, unconventional pairings that add personality and visual interest to a space.

Users are experimenting with combinations like dusty pink and forest green, mustard yellow and deep purple, or navy blue and burnt orange. These bold color choices are being applied to everything from accent walls and furniture pieces to smaller decor items like throw pillows and artwork, creating spaces that are truly unique and eye-catching.

Related Articles

  • Mid Century Modern House – Timeless Architecture and Design Trends
  • 9 Most Trendy Ranch Style House Exterior Paint Colors
  • The Latest Kitchen Trends: How Many Have You Considered?

Whether you’re looking to completely overhaul your living space or simply want to incorporate a few fresh ideas into your existing decor, these Pinterest-driven trends provide plenty of inspiration to get you started. Remember, the key to successfully implementing any trend is to make it your own – don’t be afraid to experiment, mix and match, and let your personal style shine through. Happy pinning, and may your home be filled with the perfect blend of trendy and timeless design elements!

Ready to bring new life to your home? Subscribe to our newsletter for exclusive interior design tips, trends, and ideas that will transform your space. Click here to subscribe!

Sherry is a blogger who loves to live her life to the fullest. She enjoys everything associated with design, décor and stylish modern trends. Born in California, Sherry has grown up on open ranches and in a wild setting, which has defined her taste for design and developed her interest in examining how structures and homes interact with the beauti[...]
